intro: Ononis arganietorum, commonly known as the Canary Island bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal and inland areas. Its leaves are opposite and have a slightly hairy texture, while its fruit is a small, dry capsule. Ononis arganietorum plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat and is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to the island's environment.
